info.description: Use your Android phone to send and receive SMS messages via a simple programmable API with end-to-end encryption.
info.title: httpSMS API Reference

get.description: Get the summary of sent and received messages for a user in the current month
Get billing usage records of sent and received messages for a user in the past. It will be sorted by timestamp in descending order.

post.description: Sends bulk SMS messages to multiple users based on our [CSV template](https://httpsms.com/templates/httpsms-bulk.csv) or our [Excel template](https://httpsms.com/templates/httpsms-bulk.xlsx).

parameters.description: The Excel or CSV file containing the messages to be sent.
parameters.name: document

get.description: Get the discord integrations of a user
get.summary: Get discord integrations of a user

parameters.description: number of discord integrations to skip
parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: number of discord integrations to return
parameters.name: limit

post.description: Store a discord integration for the authenticated user

parameters.description: Payload of the discord integration request
parameters.name: payload

put.description: Update a discord integration for the currently authenticated user

parameters.description: Payload of discord integration to update
parameters.name: payload

delete.description: Delete a discord integration for a user

post.description: Publish a discord event to the registered listeners

get.description: Get the last time a phone number requested for outstanding messages. It will be sorted by timestamp in descending order.
get.summary: Get heartbeats of an owner phone number

post.description: Store the heartbeat to make notify that a phone number is still active
post.summary: Register heartbeat of an owner phone number

post.description: Sends an SMS message from the 3CX platform

get.description: Get list of contacts which a phone number has communicated with (threads). It will be sorted by timestamp in descending order.
get.summary: Get message threads for a phone number

put.description: Updates the details of a message thread

parameters.description: Payload of message thread details to update
parameters.name: payload

delete.description: Delete a message thread from the database and also deletes all the messages in the thread.
delete.summary: Delete a message thread from the database.

get.description: Get list of messages which are sent between 2 phone numbers. It will be sorted by timestamp in descending order.
get.summary: Get messages which are sent between 2 phone numbers

post.description: Add bulk SMS messages to be sent by the android phone
This endpoint is called by the httpSMS android app to register a missed call event on the mobile phone.
post.summary: Register a missed call event on the mobile phone

parameters.description: Payload of the missed call event.
parameters.name: payload

get.description: Get an outstanding message to be sent by an android phone

post.description: Add a new message received from a mobile phone
post.summary: Receive a new SMS message from a mobile phone

get.description: This returns the list of all messages based on the filter criteria including missed calls
get.summary: Search all messages of a user

post.description: Add a new SMS message to be sent by your Android phone

delete.description: Delete a message from the database and removes the message content from the list of threads.
delete.summary: Delete a message from the database.

post.description: Use this endpoint to send events for a message when it is failed, sent or delivered by the mobile phone.
post.summary: Upsert an event for a message on the mobile phone

get.description: Get list phone API keys which a user has registered on the httpSMS application
get.summary: Get the phone API keys of a user

parameters.description: number of phone api keys to skip
parameters.name: skip

parameters.description: filter phone api keys with name containing query
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: number of phone api keys to return
parameters.name: limit

post.description: Creates a new phone API key which can be used to log in to the httpSMS app on your Android phone

parameters.description: Payload of new phone API key.
parameters.name: payload

delete.description: Delete a phone API Key from the database and cannot be used for authentication anymore.
delete.summary: Delete a phone API key from the database.

parameters.description: ID of the phone API key
parameters.name: phoneAPIKeyID

delete.description: You will need to login again to the httpSMS app on your Android phone with a new phone API key.
delete.summary: Remove the association of a phone from the phone API key.

parameters.description: ID of the phone API key
parameters.name: phoneAPIKeyID

get.description: Get list of phones which a user has registered on the http sms application

put.description: Updates properties of a user's phone. If the phone with this number does not exist, a new one will be created. Think of this method like an 'upsert'
Updates the FCM token of a phone. If the phone with this number does not exist, a new one will be created. Think of this method like an 'upsert'
put.summary: Upserts the FCM token of a phone

delete.description: Delete a phone that has been sored in the database

get.description: Get details of the currently authenticated user

put.description: Updates the details of the currently authenticated user

parameters.description: Payload of user details to update
parameters.name: payload

delete.description: Deletes the currently authenticated user together with all their data.
Cancel the subscription of the authenticated user.

get.description: Fetches the subscription URL of the authenticated user.
get.summary: Currently authenticated user subscription update URL

post.description: Generates a new invoice PDF file for the given subscription payment with given parameters.

get.description: Subscription payments are generated throughout the lifecycle of a subscription, typically there is one at the time of purchase and then one for each renewal.

delete.description: Rotate the user's API key in case the current API Key is compromised

parameters.description: ID of the user to update
parameters.name: userID

put.description: Update the email notification settings for a user

parameters.description: ID of the user to update
parameters.name: userID

get.description: Get the webhooks of a user

post.description: Store a webhook for the authenticated user

put.description: Update a webhook for the currently authenticated user

parameters.description: Payload of webhook details to update
parameters.name: payload

delete.description: Delete a webhook for a user

content.example: This is a sample text message

send_time.description: SendDuration is the number of nanoseconds from when the request was received until when the mobile phone send the message

sim.description:
SIM is the SIM card to use to send the message
* SMS1: use the SIM card in slot 1
* SMS2: use the SIM card in slot 2
* DEFAULT: used the default communication SIM card

last_message_content.example: This is a sample message content

max_send_attempts.description: MaxSendAttempts determines how many times to retry sending an SMS message

message_expiration_seconds.description: MessageExpirationSeconds is the duration in seconds after sending a message when it is considered to be expired.

missed_call_auto_reply.example: This phone cannot receive calls. Please send an SMS instead.

sim.description: SIM card that received the message

content.example: This is a sample text message

encrypted.description: Encrypted is used to determine if the content is end-to-end encrypted. Make sure to set the encryption key on the httpSMS mobile app

request_id.description: RequestID is an optional parameter used to track a request from the client's perspective

event_name.description:
EventName is the type of event
* SENT: is emitted when a message is sent by the mobile phone
* FAILED: is event is emitted when the message could not be sent by the mobile phone
* DELIVERED: is event is emitted when a delivery report has been received by the mobile phone

reason.description: Reason is the exact error message in case the event is an error

timestamp.description: Timestamp is the time when the event was emitted, Please send the timestamp in UTC with as much precision as possible

content.example: This is a sample text message received on a phone

encrypted.description: Encrypted is used to determine if the content is end-to-end encrypted. Make sure to set the encryption key on the httpSMS mobile app

sim.description: SIM card that received the message

timestamp.description: Timestamp is the time when the event was emitted, Please send the timestamp in UTC with as much precision as possible

content.example: This is a sample text message

encrypted.description: Encrypted is an optional parameter used to determine if the content is end-to-end encrypted. Make sure to set the encryption key on the httpSMS mobile app

request_id.description: RequestID is an optional parameter used to track a request from the client's perspective

send_at.description: SendAt is an optional parameter used to schedule a message to be sent in the future. The time is considered to be in your profile's local timezone and you can queue messages for up to 20 days (480 hours) in the future.

sim.description: SIM is the SIM slot of the phone in case the phone has more than 1 SIM slot

max_send_attempts.description: MaxSendAttempts is the number of attempts when sending an SMS message to handle the case where the phone is offline.

message_expiration_seconds.description: MessageExpirationSeconds is the duration in seconds after sending a message when it is considered to be expired.

missed_call_auto_reply.example: e.g. This phone cannot receive calls. Please send an SMS instead.

sim.description: SIM is the SIM slot of the phone in case the phone has more than 1 SIM slot

data.example: The request body is not a valid JSON string

message.example: We ran into an internal error while handling the request.

data.example: Make sure your API key is set in the [X-API-Key] header in the request

message.example: You are not authorized to carry out this request.
